Sentencas: La0.2Sr0.8TiO3+delta (LST)-based perovskite oxide is considered as a promising anode material for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) because of its strong phase stability.
Titulo: Enhancing Stability and Catalytic Activity by In Situ Exsolution for High-Performance Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Herein, this work develops a strategy to enhance its catalytic performance for electrochemical reactions by fabricating highly active metal-perovskite heterogeneous interfaces.
Titulo: Enhancing Stability and Catalytic Activity by In Situ Exsolution for High-Performance Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: A series of B site doped (La0.2Sr0.8)(0.925)Ti0.55Mn0.35X0.1O3-delta (LSTMX, X = Ni, Co, and Fe) are synthesized and studied as the anodes of SOFCs with wet CH4 as the fuel.
Titulo: Enhancing Stability and Catalytic Activity by In Situ Exsolution for High-Performance Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: The X metal nanoparticles can be in situ exsolved in an anode atmosphere, and the generated active interfaces remarkably enhance the activity of the electrochemical oxidation of CH4.
Titulo: Enhancing Stability and Catalytic Activity by In Situ Exsolution for High-Performance Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: The stable perovskite substrate and the nanoparticles can also synergistically promote the elimination of deposited carbon.
Titulo: Enhancing Stability and Catalytic Activity by In Situ Exsolution for High-Performance Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: A single cell with the Ni-doped LSTMN anode delivers the optimal maximum power density of 388 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C with wet CH4 as the fuel and an excellent output stability of 100 h at 700 degrees C, which is much higher than that with (La0.2Sr0.8)(0.925)Ti0.55Mn0.45O3-delta (LSTM) anodes.
Titulo: Enhancing Stability and Catalytic Activity by In Situ Exsolution for High-Performance Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: These results propose an effective strategy for the development of high-performance electrode materials for direct hydrocarbon SOFC applications.
Titulo: Enhancing Stability and Catalytic Activity by In Situ Exsolution for High-Performance Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes
